critique: The document aims to prevent disruption of interstate commerce. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is joy that the transportation service will continue uninterrupted. There is also an element of fear that the dispute could disrupt interstate commerce, which the President is trying to alleviate. There is a sense of sadness that the dispute has occurred, but the President is taking action to resolve it. There is no indication of anger or disgust. Surprise is not a major factor, as the dispute was anticipated.
